facts.text: Previous award in I.D. No. 20 of 1957 passed by Industrial Tribunal on September 26, 1958, published in State Gazette on October 30, 1958.

Award became enforceable under section 17A after 30 days from publication, i.e., from November 29, 1958, operative for one year under section 19(3), and continued under section 19(6) until two months after notice of termination.
On March 8, 1968, Hydra Industries Staff Union submitted charter of demands to management, including categorization, scales of pay, dearness allowance, inconsistent with previous award.
Union desired management to consider demands by March 30, 1968.
On April 5, 1968, union general body passed resolution regretting management's inaction and intimating indefinite strike from April 15, 1968.
On April 6, 1968, union sent copy of resolution to appellant.
Workmen went on strike from April 15, 1968 to April 30, 1968.
On April 30, 1968, Assistant Labour Commissioner held conciliation proceedings; agreement reached that general demands would be taken up in conciliation.
Conciliation Officer reported on June 24, 1968, that conciliation failed; management not inclined to consider demands as fixed by previous award not terminated.
State Government referred dispute on July 25, 1968, to Industrial Tribunal as I.D. No. 43 of 1968.
Industrial Tribunal by award dated October 31, 1969, upheld preliminary objection, held previous award not terminated, reference incompetent.
Workmen filed Writ Petition No. 4186 of 1969; single Judge on December 8, 1969, dismissed, agreed with Tribunal.
Division Bench in Writ Appeal No. 31 of 1970 on September 23, 1970, reversed, held previous award terminated, reference competent, directed Tribunal to decide on merits.
Appeal to Supreme Court by certificate.

legal_issues.text: Whether the previous award in I.D. No. 20 of 1957 had been terminated under section 19(6) of the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947, making the reference dated July 25, 1968, competent.

petitioner_arguments.text: Previous award in I.D. No. 20 of 1957 not terminated as no notice under section 19(6) given; charter of demands does not constitute termination notice; reference incompetent.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 19(6) Industrial Disputes Act; Management of Bangalore Woollen, Cotton Silk Mills Co. Ltd. v. The Workmen

respondent_arguments.text: Previous award terminated by charter of demands on March 8, 1968 (inconsistent with award), strike from April 15-30, 1968, and management's participation in conciliation on April 30, 1968.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Section 19(6) Industrial Disputes Act; Workmen of Western India Match Co. Ltd. v. Western India Match Co. Ltd.

court_reasoning.text: No notice terminating previous award as required by section 19(6); charter of demands does not indicate intention to terminate with reference to particular date; strike and conciliation participation do not satisfy requirement.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Termination must be with reference to a particular date for certainty; charter does not give such indication.

court_reasoning.text: Even if charter terminated award on March 8, 1968, it continues for two months under section 19(6); strike before expiry indicates no proper termination.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Reference on July 25, 1968, within period award binding.

court_reasoning.text: Bangalore Woollen case followed: need clear intimation of termination date. Western India Match case distinguished: termination fixed by specific letter, not mere demands.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Mere charter of demands without more does not terminate award.

holdings.text: Previous award not terminated under section 19(6); present reference incompetent.

precedents_cited.case_name: Management of Bangalore Woollen, Cotton Silk Mills Co. Ltd. v. The Workmen
precedents_cited.relevance: Termination of award requires clear intimation of intention with reference to particular date.

precedents_cited.case_name: Workmen of Western India Match Co. Ltd. v. The Western India Match Co. Ltd.
precedents_cited.relevance: Termination by specific letter dated April 8, 1957, not mere charter of demands; explained in Bangalore Woollen case.

statutes_cited.name: Industrial Disputes Act, 1947
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs operation, enforceability, and termination of awards; award continues until two months after notice of termination.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; judgment and order of Andhra Pradesh High Court Division Bench in Writ Appeal No. 31 of 1970 set aside; previous award not terminated, reference incompetent.
outcome.relief_granted: Restoration of Tribunal and single Judge orders holding reference incompetent.

key_quotes.text: The union must establish the point of time when the previous award has been terminated.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Emphasizes need for specific date of termination under s.19(6).

key_quotes.text: Though there is no particular form in which the notice of termination has to be given, still it is absolutely essential that the intention to terminate the award, with reference to a particular date, must be made clear.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on requirements for valid termination notice.
